Summary Dvira is a designer and an expert in everything to do with residential and commercial design. In addition to her interior designer title, Dvira is also a tv personality, a prop stylist, a style editor, a trend specialist and everything in between. With a degree in architecture from the University of Toronto and a masters in interior design from Pratt Institute in New York, Dvira has also managed to trot the globe on a mission to discover the world in the context of design and architecture. Her career has led her to work on an extensive line of design projects and be a part of some of the most renowned design firms. Most notably Dvira was a winner of a reality show called From The Ground Up, where she beat out 9,000 applicants and 14 finalists who competed to become Debbie Travis's Chief Designer. Dvira is the current leed designer and art director for the hit television show "Income Property" (season I, II & III). Dvira also currently manages and runs her own design firm. Summary I'm Will Ward, a Designer with over 4 years of professional experience working in ad agencies and small design shops. I have a passion for creating meaningful products people care about and solving problems through research, insight, and exploration of great ideas. 
 
I'm a firm believer in user focused visual communications, where great ideas start from small insights and grow into powerful executions. Insists that the best designers are only as good as the team that pushes each other to new heights, and can bring new perspectives to the table, encourage one another’s growth, and development. 
 
BRAINSTORMING 
Experienced at developing ideas that not only aim to solve client / brand problems, but also creates a meaningful product experience for it’s audience through well planned research and insights that drive creative execution. 
 
DESIGN 
Well versed in traditional design principals that give purpose, and life to a product; significantly resonating with it’s audience through the process of intuitive exploration, and refinement. 
 
COLLABORATIVE 
Accustomed to working within a team environment, whether it’s collectively solving problems together or independently exploring solutions and regrouping as a team throughout the process. 
 
TECHNICAL 
Efficient at developing productive and organized work flows to tackle a wide range of project mediums and deadlines. 
Industry skill sets: Art Direction, Visual Design, Brand Identity, Packaging, Concepting, Campaign Development, E-mail Marketing, Banner Ads, Mobile Development, Advanced Typography, and Production of final deliverables. 
 
Software skill sets: Adobe Creative Cloud Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Dreamweaver Flash, and Sketch 3. Experience Freelance Art Director Yahoo May 2015  – Present (4 months) Sunnyvale, California Working as an Art Director / Designer for a world-class brand within the Creative Department, operating on an ad agency model, and servicing a wide range of internal and consumer facing creative needs.  
 
Responsibilities include:  
 
— Reporting to the Creative Director and VP of Creative, vetting concepts and creative for approval. 
— Concepting with a Sr. Copywriter to develop over-arching brand campaign ideas that work across video, web and social media platforms. 
— Collaborating with the product team and working within Sketch files to develop custom UI Screens that pair with campaign creative. Art Director and Designer Freelance March 2011  – Present (4 years 6 months) San Francisco Bay Area Studio Artist, Art Direction Geometry Global (Formerly G2 Direct and Digital) April 2014  –  April 2015  (1 year 1 month) San Francisco Bay Area Worked within a hybrid role between art direction and production design. 
 
Clients: Adobe, Microsoft Mobile, Docusign, Flexjet and SFSPCA. 
 
Type of art direction and design work includes: email campaigns, brand identity, point of sale displays, brand standards, animated banners, storyboards 
 
— Developing write-ups for digital and experiential campaigns pairing up with a writer or as group and creating proof of concepts. 
— Executing look and feel of concepts, flushing out multiple directions to present to client. 
— Refining creative for client presentations and building out the presentation decks. 
— Finalizing and packaging projects, both for web and print to either hand off to vendors or directly to the client.  
— Working with a web developer to insure creative concepts accurately get carried through to html. Associate, Designer (Contract) True Action, an eBay Inc. Company July 2013  –  April 2014  (10 months) san francisco, california Clients: PayPal, Wells Fargo, eBay and new business pitches. 
 
Worked within a team along side another Designer, Copywriter and Production Artist, with oversight from our ACD Writer, and Sr Designer.  
 
- Developed a large-scale website concept, comping up individual pages of content at a time often on an accelerated timeline and presenting progress to the client at check-points. 
- Responsible for providing design support on digital campaigns containing: websites, email communications, web banners and social media content. 
- As a designer I was responsible for working with and developing some user interface components, layouts comps, and developing photography styles for digital campaigns, and presentation materials. Freelance Designer International Color Services September 2011  –  April 2012  (8 months) Scottsdale, Arizona Was part of a iPad application development team "iCatalog" My team and I were responsible for taking existing catalogs and creating a unique catalog experience on the iPad. I produced graphics and elements within the apps for fashion and retail clients Lilly Pulitzer, Down East Basics, Steve Madden, and Tumi.  
 
In addition I was trained to perform color retouching on clothing products and product cutouts using masking techniques in Photoshop. — Collaborated with the Creative Director producing work with a high turnaround rate.
